DataElement.preferredName: IWG-MRT Myelofibrosis Molecular Response Status Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the IWG-MRT myelofibrosis molecular response.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Molecular response evaluation must be analyzed in peripheral blood granulocytes and requires confirmation by repeat testing within 6 months window. Complete response: Eradication of a pre-existing abnormality. Partial response: greater than or equal to 50 percent decrease in allele burden (partial response applies only to patients with at least 20 percent mutant allele burden at baseline.) (adapted from Revised Response Criteria for Myelofibrosis: International Working Group-Myeloproliferative Neoplasms Research and Treatment (IWG-MRT) and European LeukemiaNet (ELN) consensus report. BLOOD 22 AUGUST 2013 x VOLUME 122 NUMBER 8)_A condition or state at a particular time.

PermissibleValues.value: Re-emergence of a pre-existing molecular abnormality

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.: Having been present before a specific date or event.: A molecular or cytogenic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models.

Concepts.definition: The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.
Having been present before a specific date or event.
A molecular or cytogenetic abnormality which occurs in either human disease states or disease models.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than or equal to 50% decrease in allele burden.
Does not meet the CR or PR criteria.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
